topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces the show and guest Marily Nika, her experience at Meta/Google, and what the episode will cover (AI trends, resources, and technical basics).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Amplitude, EPPO, and later Pando.

topics.title: Staying current: newsletters and AI media
topics.summary: Marily shares how she stays up to date (newsletters like MIT Tech Review’s The Download) and why non-AI tech sources increasingly matter as AI becomes embedded everywhere.

topics.title: AI hype vs reality beyond ChatGPT
topics.summary: They discuss what’s overhyped (fear of replacement) and what’s underhyped (breadth of AI capabilities beyond ChatGPT, e.g., emerging lie detection research).

topics.title: How PMs use ChatGPT day-to-day
topics.summary: Marily explains practical workflows: rewriting mission statements for broad clarity, generating user segments/personas, and brainstorming—using AI as an enhancer, not a replacement.

topics.title: Why every PM becomes an AI PM
topics.summary: Marily argues AI will be default in products via personalization, recommendations, and automation, and PMs will need to collaborate closely with research scientists and embrace uncertainty.

topics.title: Getting started: mindset, data, and problems
topics.summary: Advice for non-technical PMs: don’t be overwhelmed, look for ways to use existing data to improve experiences (security, fraud, personalization), and start by identifying real pain points.

topics.title: When not to use AI: avoid MVP traps
topics.summary: Marily warns against using AI for MVP validation; instead prototype/fake the AI with Figma to test demand, and only invest in models when you have data and a proven need.

topics.title: Data needs and build-vs-buy model decisions
topics.summary: They cover how data requirements vary by task, why startups often lack sufficient data, and when training proprietary models matters for differentiation versus using shared datasets or public models.

topics.title: What models are and how training works
topics.summary: Marily explains models with a child-learning analogy, describes training as repeated exposure to labeled examples, and discusses pattern learning and probabilistic outputs.

topics.title: Cool AI applications: real-time translation glasses
topics.summary: Marily shares an impactful example from Google AR/VR: glasses that transcribe and translate speech live, highlighting how AI enables new product experiences.

topics.title: Will AI replace PMs? Skills to invest in
topics.summary: Marily argues AI won’t replace PMs but will remove tedious work; she encourages PMs to learn fundamentals (including coding) to build confidence and better partner with technical teams.

topics.title: Learning resources: courses and coding bootcamps
topics.summary: Marily recommends learning paths depending on style: Coursera/Stanford intro AI for self-paced learners and CareerFoundry, General Assembly, and Coding Dojo for cohort-based learning.

topics.title: Becoming an AI PM: course overview and challenges
topics.summary: They discuss what AI PMs should learn (AI product lifecycle differences, working with researchers, interviewing), plus key challenges: uncertainty, leadership expectations, and data collection difficulty.

topics.title: Getting buy-in for ML and bridging research to product
topics.summary: Marily shares tactics for leadership buy-in using adjacent successes, contingency plans, and trust-building; they also discuss tracking academia (arXiv) and PMs’ role in monetizing research.

topics.title: Course structure, projects, and no-code AutoML
topics.summary: Marily outlines her 3-week, 9-workshop course, highlights hands-on capstone projects, shares examples (x-ray classifier), and points to no-code tooling like Google Cloud AutoML.

topics.title: Building and updating a course like a product
topics.summary: Marily explains how she iterated on audience and curriculum via user research, community, and direct support, and how fast-moving AI forced updates (e.g., adding a ChatGPT module).

topics.title: Lightning round: books, podcasts, tools, and questions
topics.summary: Quick recommendations: books (Inspired, You Look Like a Thing and I Love You), Boz’s podcast, White Lotus, an interview question about explaining databases simply, and AI tools like ChatGPT and Lensa.
